definition: (of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate

to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

to part without hard feelings (idiom)/to cut the knot as smoothly as you tied it

can't come to an agreement
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other

lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)

to make oneself scarce/to slip away/to take French leave

definition: to part on bad terms/(of a meeting etc) to break up in discord

lit. to take different roads and urge the horses on (idiom)/fig. to part ways

to become enemies (idiom); to fall out with sb
